answers.answer: I assume after just 12 days your family member is still on strong pain relief. I found these made me feel tired and ruined my appetite. After 3 weeks I was able to change to weaker ones and found my appetite returned, and I had a lot more energy.

I quit the pain meds early on after my discharge and used over the counter products as Opiates make me pretty ill, but certainly pain meds will make one very tired.  However, I was very tired for a month after my bypass.  There are all sorts of changes going on in the body after major surgury.  Often, there are blood sugar issues as well as digestive issues.  In my case, my diabetes issues flared, and food simply tasted terrible to me for about a month.  It sounds to me like he is recovering as most of do, it's a procedure that takes about a year to totally from.He will probably start physical rehabilitation soon, and his recovery will be monitored.  Keep us informed.

question: Hello, my family member recently had a quintuple bypass surgery about 12 days ago. the hospital released him about 3 or 4 days after surgery. he is now home, he is 58 and he says that he has been feeling very tired. he sleeps for a couple hours and then wakes up and walks around a little bit. i was wondering if it is normal for him to be feeling really tired, he sleeps but when he wakes up hes still tired. could this be because hes not eating enough or, exerting himself too much. thank you for listening and plz help me.
title: Quintuple bypass surgery
